title: How to Make Cream Vegetable Soup With Oregano and Flat Leaf Parsley

steps.headline: Chop 1 medium onion, 2 large chopped carrots, 1 pepper of your choice, 1 stalk celery, 2 stalks asparagus, other vegetables to taste.
Cut the vegetables into course chop.
Bring 1 quart water to rolling boil over high heat.
Add black pepper, thyme, parsley, or spice-mix.
Turn heat down to medium-low and simmer for 1 hour.
Strain out the solids and use or freeze the stock.
Melt the butter in a large soup pot over medium heat.
Add the flour and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, for 2 minutes more.
Pour in the stock and bring to a boil while whisking constantly.
Add the hard vegetables (onion, celery, potato, and carrots) and cook, covered, stirring occasionally, until soft, about 12 minutes.
Tie the parsley sprigs, thyme, and bay leaf with a piece of kitchen twine and add to the soup.
Whisk in the heavy cream, sherry, and salt into the soup and season with pepper to taste.
Lower the heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Strain the soup, returning the soup to the pot and blend with an immersion blender to make it creamier, if desired.
Remove and discard the herb bundle.
Divide among soup bowls, sprinkle the top of each soup with the chopped parsley and serve immediately.
steps.description: Add dollop of sour cream if desired.

text: Broth or stock Chop 1 medium onion, 2 large chopped carrots, 1 pepper of your choice, 1 stalk celery, 2 stalks asparagus, other vegetables to taste. (Optional cooked meat of choice.) Cut the vegetables into course chop.  Bring 1 quart water to rolling boil over high heat. Add vegetables. Add black pepper, thyme, parsley, or spice-mix. Salt to taste. Turn heat down to medium-low and simmer for 1 hour.  Strain out the solids and use or freeze the stock.  Soup Melt the butter in a large soup pot over medium heat.  Add the flour and cook, stirring with a wooden spoon, for 2 minutes more.  Pour in the stock and bring to a boil while whisking constantly.  Add the hard vegetables (onion, celery, potato, and carrots) and cook, covered, stirring occasionally, until soft, about 12 minutes.  Tie the parsley sprigs, thyme, and bay leaf with a piece of kitchen twine and add to the soup.  Add the tomato, cucumber, kale.  Whisk in the heavy cream, sherry, and salt into the soup and season with pepper to taste.  Lower the heat and simmer for 15 minutes.  Strain the soup, returning the soup to the pot and blend with an immersion blender to make it creamier, if desired.  Remove and discard the herb bundle.  Divide among soup bowls, sprinkle the top of each soup with the chopped parsley and serve immediately. Add dollop of sour cream if desired.
